item.title: Frozen zabaglione recipe
item.description:
Frozen zabaglione recipe

Some people don't have a big kitchen, or a lot of kitchen equipment. I think I have everything that's available, and at some point, may start an equipment rental business to drum up some extra cash.

item.title: Baccalá Stuffed Courgette Flowers Recipe - Great British Chefs
item.description:
Baccalá Stuffed Courgette Flowers Recipe - Great British Chefs

Cut the softened cod into small pieces and add to a large pan or casserole with the bay leaf and 1 clove of garlic. Cover with the milk and water and bring everything to the boil, simmering for 2 hours Meanwhile, place 25ml of the sunflower oil in a small pan with the remaining garlic clove.

item.title: Sindhi Aloo Tuk - Fried smashed potato with chilli, salt & tangy chaat masala - Maunika Gowardhan
item.description:
Sindhi Aloo Tuk - Fried smashed potato with chilli, salt & tangy chaat masala - Maunika Gowardhan

I must admit I am a little embarrassed to even share this recipe given how easy it is! I yearn for an home cooked meal when it comes to mid week dinners. So my top picks for quicker recipes definitely include thoran and chickpea curry.

item.title: Lucknowi Achari Gobi - Cauliflower cooked in pickling spices with turmeric, chilli and mango powder - Maunika Gowardhan
item.description:
Lucknowi Achari Gobi - Cauliflower cooked in pickling spices with turmeric, chilli and mango powder - Maunika Gowardhan

When I look through my book of hand written notes from my travels there are many stories and recipes I still have left to share. I suppose my space here gives me a chance to do that (albeit not as often as I'd like to!)

item.title: Sindhi Kadhi Chawal - Vegetable curry with tamarind, curry leaves and green chillies - Maunika Gowardhan
item.description:
Sindhi Kadhi Chawal - Vegetable curry with tamarind, curry leaves and green chillies - Maunika Gowardhan

Sunday afternoons are for Sindhi Kadhi, chawal (plain rice) and aloo tuk. There is something so comforting about a meal like this; given how simple it is to cook. A soupy kadhi that's tangy, hot, spicy and moreish mixed in with rice.

item.title: Rhubarb and Custard Ice Pops Recipe
item.description:
Rhubarb and Custard Ice Pops Recipe

Directions For the rhubarb: Put the water and sugar in a medium saucepan and bring to a simmer. Simmer until the sugar has dissolved. Add the rhubarb and simmer for an additional 10 minutes, or until the rhubarb has broken down. Remove the pan from the heat.

item.title: Crispy Citrus-Candied Pistachios Recipe
item.description:
Crispy Citrus-Candied Pistachios Recipe

This recipe takes advantage of our Fresh Lemon Syrup, which doesn't contain any added water or juice, helping the pistachios toast up extra crisp and crunchy. The syrup's subtle acidity brightens the darker notes of the roasted nuts and caramelized sugar, keeping the overall flavor fresh and light, perfect for sprinkling over spring salads and fruity desserts, or just snacking out of hand.
